intro: Diodia muricata, commonly known as rough diodia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Diodia muricata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
